public: ref class ImmutableList<T>::Builder sealed : System::Collections::Generic::ICollection<T>, System::Collections::Generic::IEnumerable<T>, System::Collections::Generic::IList<T>, System::Collections::Generic::IReadOnlyCollection<T>, System::Collections::Generic::IReadOnlyList<T>, System::Collections::IList

type ImmutableList<'T>.Builder = class interface ICollection<'T> interface seq<'T> interface IEnumerable interface IList<'T> interface IReadOnlyCollection<'T> interface IReadOnlyList<'T> interface ICollection interface IList

summary.span: 表示一个只需少量或者无需内存分配就能转变，并且可以有效生成不可变列表实例或者构建于此类实例之上的列表。

span.span: Represents a list that mutates with little or no memory allocations and that can produce or build on immutable list instances very efficiently.

summary.span: **NuGet package**: System.Collections.Immutable（关于不可变集合和安装方法）

span.span: **NuGet package**: System.Collections.Immutable (about immutable collections and how to install)

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管和其他方法已提供在列表中，快速大容量更改操作类允许多个组合要用相等的效率对列表的更改。Although and other methods already provide fast bulk change operations on the list, the class allows multiple combinations of changes to be made to a list with equal efficiency.

summary.span: 使用默认比较器在整个 中搜索元素，并返回该元素的从零开始的索引。

span.span: Searches the entire for an element using the default comparer and returns the zero-based index of the element.

returns.span: 如果找到项，则为 中项的从零开始的索引；否则为一个负数，该负数是大于 的下一个元素的索引的按位求补。

span.span: The zero-based index of item in the , if item is found; otherwise, a negative number that is the bitwise complement of the index of the next element that is larger than .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果不包含指定的值，该方法返回一个负整数。If the does not contain the specified value, the method returns a negative integer. 您可以应用于此负整数，以获取大于搜索值的第一个元素的索引的按位求补运算 （~）。You can apply the bitwise complement operation (~) to this negative integer to get the index of the first element that is larger than the search value. 当将值插入到，此索引应使用作为插入点，以保持排序顺序。When inserting the value into the , this index should be used as the insertion point to maintain the sort order.
